I just came across this with a Firefox 4.0 RC1 user in mozilla.support.firefox.
<http://groups.google.com/group/mozilla.support.firefox/browse_frm/thread/7ee9dec152395659>

STR:
1. Go to Options-->General, and set Firefox to open in a blank page, and in the Tabs panel, uncheck "Always show the tab bar".
2. Start Firefox.
3. Open the Add-ons manager (Firefox-->Add-ons or Tools-->Add-ons).

Result:
The Add-ons manager replaces the only tab, and there's no way to go on to surf the web from there, without opening a new tab via menu or keyboard shortcut.

What should happen:
IMO, the Add-ons manager should open in a new tab even if the current page is about:blank.

This behaviour doesn't bother me either.  As a matter of fact, a lot of applications adopt this behaviour and consider it as a common practice.  Consider these:
* When you open a blank page in a browser, then you (left) click a bookmark, it's open in the same blank page
* When you run Word, it opens an empty doc.  When you double-click on a Word doc, it's opened in Word to replace the empty doc
* It's also like this in Excel and a lot of text editors.

Is it really a big bother to you?

OK, I see.  But whether the fact that you "have to open a *new tab* before you can close the AOM" is an annoyance or not is very very subjective.  Personally, I could live with more than one tab so I *don't* have to "exit and restart" the program.  And I use Ctrl+T and other keyboard shortcuts a lot.

Back to what you said, there might be a solution: don't put the tabs on top.  There are two ways to achieve this:
* if your menu bar is hidden:
  Firefox (button) > Options > (uncheck) Tabs on Top

* if your menu bar is not hidden:
  View (menu) > Toolbars > (uncheck) Tabs on Top

HTH

I don't want to continue on this subjective matter.  I mean, if I use the mouse, I don't see how hard it is to click the + symbol to open a new tab.  And if I use keyboard, I don't see how hard it is to press Ctrl+L (note that the key is the same whether AOM is open or not) or Ctrl+T then Ctrl+L.

You could ask your friends around you to see if this is really annoying to them or not.

So, I'd like to close this bug as RESOLVED-INVALID if you're OK.  Otherwise, I'll just leave it but I'm pretty sure the result will be the same.

OTOH, maybe you'll have better chance if you file new requests for enhancements:
1. An advanced option to show URL bar within AOM
2. An advanced option NOT to reuse blank tab when AOM is open.

Goog luck.

comments.text:
I manage the computers at a small business. Everybody searches from the URL-bar so they like starting with Blank Pages so the cursor auto-orients in the URL-bar. People keep complaining because they get "trapped" when opening the Add-ons Manager. They want to use the tab that the Add-ons manager is in to start a web search. But they are forced to opening a new tab and then closing the Tab the Add-ons Manager is in. 

This is not an efficient design. Add-on Manager should always open in its own New Tab.
